page.title: 02KINGSCLERE'S CHURCHES
page.content: In Kingsclere there are three churches.{St. Mary's (C. of E.)}dates from Norman times.It is built of flint and stone,and has a square tower with a peal of eight bells which are rung before services. There is a choir, and a Sunday-school meets during the morning service. Kneelers were made by local people, and show the badges of many local clubs. A stained-glass window in memory of the trainer, William Hastings-Bass, shows racehorses on the downs, and another window associated with a previous trainer, John Porter, also has a picture of a horse. The tower has a weather-vane which represents a bed-bug. King John is said to have stayed in the village inn and been bitten by bed-bugs - according to legend. r
